metadata.name: PowerShell Web Access Feature Enabled Via DISM
metadata.comment: Detects the use of DISM to enable the PowerShell Web Access feature, which could be used for remote access and potential abuse

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\dism.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('dism.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('windowspowershellwebaccess')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/online')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/enable-feature')))

output.summary: Detects the use of DISM to enable the PowerShell Web Access feature, which could be used for remote access and potential abuse

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate PowerShell Web Access installations by administrators References: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/dism/enable-windowsoptionalfeature, https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa24-241a, https://gist.github.com/MHaggis/7e67b659af9148fa593cf2402edebb41
